alert.note: Alert for Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 3:49PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Kimball and east central Laramie Counties through 330 PM MDT... At 248 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pine Bluffs, or 19 miles west of Kimball, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pine Bluffs, Oliver Campground, Panorama Point, Oliver Reservoir and Bushnell. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 397 and 402. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 1 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
